member.name: T:TZ4Net.BigEndianBitConverter
member.summary: Implementation of EndianBitConverter which converts to/from big-endian byte arrays.

member.name: T:TZ4Net.EndianBitConverter
member.summary: Equivalent of System.BitConverter, but with either endianness.

member.name: M:TZ4Net.EndianBitConverter.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
member.returns: true if this converter is little-endian, false otherwise.

member.param: The number to convert.
member.returns: A 64-bit signed integer whose value is equivalent to value.

member.param: The number to convert.
member.returns: A double-precision floating point number whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:TZ4Net.EndianBinaryReader.Read7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the least significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.

member.name: M:TZ4Net.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBigEndian7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the most significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:TZ4Net.EndianBinaryReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a length-prefixed string from the stream, using the encoding for this reader. A 7-bit encoded integer is first read, which specifies the number of bytes to read from the stream. These bytes are then converted into a string with the encoding for this reader.
member.returns: The string read from the stream.

member.name: T:TZ4Net.ZoneInfo
member.summary:
A TimeZone Implementation with Historical Changes and Leapseconds. Implementation of the local time zone conversion based on Olson database. This public-domain time zone database contains code and data that represent the history of local time for many representative locations around the globe. It is updated periodically to reflect changes made by political bodies to UTC offsets and daylight-saving rules. This database (often called tz or zoneinfo) is used by several implementations, including the GNU C Library used in GNU/Linux, FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Cygwin, DJGPP, HP-UX, IRIX, Mac OS X, OpenVMS, Solaris, Tru64, and UnixWare. As opposite to Win32/.NET API, it allows to perform convertion in arbitrary time zone
The code is based on Stuart D. Gathman's Java translation of the Unix "tz" package (formerly known as "localtime"). See http://www.twinsun.com/tz/tz-link.htm and http://www.bmsi.com/java/#TZ for more details. It uses Jon Skeet's EndianBitConverter. See http://www.yoda.arachsys.com/csharp/miscutil/ for more details.

member.name: M:TZ4Net.ZoneInfo.FindNearestNonDstRule(System.Int64)
member.summary: When calculating "normaltz" (the default rule) for timezone, we originally took the first non-DST rule for the current TZ. But this produces nonsensical results for areas where historical non-integer time zones were used, e.g. if GMT-2:33 was used until 1918. This loop, based on a suggestion by Ophir Bleibergh, tries to find a non-DST rule close to the given unix time. This is somewhat of a hack, but much better than the previous solution taking first non-DST rule. Tricky: we need to get either the next or previous non-DST TZ. We shall take the most recent non-DST value.
member.param: Unix time clock i.e number of seconds since epoch.
member.returns: Instance of representing most recent non-DST rule.

member.param: Time to convert. The Year, Mon, MDay, Hour, Min, Sec fields are used and validated. Other fields are computed.
Flag indicating whether the passed time is a local or utc for the zone.
member.returns: Seconds since the epoch.

member.returns: List of all zoneinfo names from given zoneinfo directory.

member.summary: Returns true if a particular date is considered part of daylight time in this zoneinfo.

member.returns: true if a particular time is considered part of daylight time in this zoneinfo.

member.name: M:TZ4Net.ZoneInfo.GetClockFromLocal(TZ4Net.ZoneInfo.Time)
member.summary: Calculates seconds since the epoch, the reverse of GetLocalTime(). Unused fields are computed and stored in localTime.
member.param: Zone's local time to convert. The Year, Mon, MDay, Hour, Min, Sec fields are used and validated. Other fields are computed.
member.returns: Seconds since the epoch.

member.name: M:TZ4Net.ZoneInfo.GetClockFromUtc(TZ4Net.ZoneInfo.Time)
member.summary: Calculates seconds since the epoch, the reverse of GetUtcTime(). Unused fields are computed and stored in localTime.
member.param: Utc time to convert. The Year, Mon, MDay, Hour, Min, Sec fields are used and validated. Other fields are computed.
member.returns: Seconds since the epoch.

member.name: M:TZ4Net.ZoneInfo.GetOffset(TZ4Net.ZoneInfo.Time)
member.summary: Return the offset of this zoneinfo from UTC for a calendar date and time.
member.param: Zone's local time to convert.
member.returns: The offset in milliseconds to add to UTC to get local time.

member.summary: Calculates local time from seconds since the epoch.

member.returns: Local time instance.

member.returns: New object with all time fields computed.
